rev.comment: /* Twentieth and Twenty-First Century guerrilla conflicts */ Rearrange to past and current

/* Twentieth and Twenty-First Century guerrilla conflicts */ The listing is of current guerilla wars, as far as I understand it; putting [[First Indochina War]] into paragraph above, however - thanks for pointing that out!
/* Twentieth and Twenty-First Century guerrilla conflicts */

/* Twentieth and Twenty-First Century guerrilla conflicts */ fixed typo
moved history piece from intro to history section
removed this detail history section and integrated the content into the "history of guerrilla warfare" wiki articlde

/* History */ remove line that may confuse readers, this book was written at the start of the Cold War
quote by [[Samuel B. Griffith]], an American commander, on the history of guerrilla warfare
/* History */ this hasn't been referenced in three years
/* History */ citations, more on its origins
/* History */ the fabian strategy is an example of [[attrition warfare]], which is very different from guerrilla warfare, also both the fabian and the scythian examples are uncited
proper placement of image next to times and mention
/* History */ Ranjit Singh was not famous for Guerrilla warfare
/* History */ images and placement next to referenced material
